bibl.title: James McGarth and William Herbert v. King County. Search Warrant.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: United States of America United States Territory of Washington, County of King ss.
To the Sheriff or any Constable of said county, greeting:
div1.p: Whereas, M.V. Mills has this day made complaint on oath to the undersigned, one of the Justices of the Peace in and for said County, that the following goods and chattels to-wit: he has reason to believe that counterfit coin of the United States and the bodies for making the same the property of said _ have been within _ days past or were on the _ day of have been by some persons unknown stolen, taken, or carried away out of the possession of the said _ in the county aforesaid and also that the said _ verily believes that the said goods or a part thereof are concealed in or about the house of _ in said County, site of faint street the faint fence south of states foundry. Therefore in the name of the United States you are commanded that with the necessary and proper asistance you enter into the said house a house designated said counterfit coin is the body for the King and diligently search for the _, and if the same or any part thereof be found on such search, being the same and also the said person whose possession the same as before forthwith before me, to be disposed of according to law.
div1.ab: Given under my hand this 18th day of March AD 1880 Roswell Scott Justice of the Peace
